comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: 18 Footers have evolved somewhat. This is a set of shots of some modern skiffs

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/iansand]  Quite a difference! But they all make for amazing photography subjects when in full flight!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 50085758@N07
comment._content: The sail plan and rig and the fact that the sail number appears to be A5 would indicate to me that this is not an 18 footer but a keel boat.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/saltypix] Hi! Thanks for your comment, we've run this pic by our sailing expert who agrees and writes: "A5 seems to be the sail number, and it’s a yacht possibly Hoana with a Bermudan rig, and is not an 18 foot skiff"

Thanks for your contribution - our records have been updated!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
